cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward landfall on the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeastward across the southeastern United States during the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana/Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: n/a – watches confined to Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from east of Morgan City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metro New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and far western Florida Panhandle; inland track through AL, GA, western SC/NC
weather_observation.wind: None – only occasional gusts below gale force expected as remnant low passes well south and east
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – surge threat confined to Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain possible Monday–Tuesday as remnants move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated for port operations at Wilmington, DE
